                                                                    ISECAvoiding ThreatsCurrent page:  Spam and Phishing Scams
                        
    		Spam and Phishing Scams
    	Remember, Chico State will NEVER ask you for your password via email! IF IT LOOKS SUSPICIOUS, DELETE THE MESSAGEIf you do accidentally send your CSU, Chico User Name and Password via email, immediately change your password using CSU, Chico Account Tools or call the ITSS Help Desk at (530) 898-HELP (4357) so they can take action to prevent problems.
                        What is Phishing?
                    Phishing scams are attempts by hackers and cybercriminals to steal personal information or hijack computing resources for nefarious purposes.The most common (and most successful) phishing scams are emails that appear to come from a legitimate source (for instance; CSU, Chico Technology Help Desk, your bank, eBay, PayPal) which contain a link that directs you to  equally legitimate-looking web pages
                        Watch this video to learn more about phishing scams!
